subject: Sigstack is disabled in favour of sigaltstack.
commitMessage:
Sigstack is disabled in favour of sigaltstack.

sigaltstack()  supersedes  the  older  sigstack()  call.  For backwards
compatibility, glibc also provides sigstack().   All  new  applications
should be written using sigaltstack().

Change-Id: I8ba9c677463d58085b1491161d8c6bfb6c4554f0
Signed-off-by: Vyacheslav Barinov <v.barinov@samsung.com>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.

Patch Set 1:

Trying to use sigstack during configure script call hangs new qemu-arm and breaks build for armv7l architecture.
Uploaded patch set 2.
Patch Set 2: Verified+1

Patch Set 2:

Verified at https://build.tizen.org/package/show?package=pth&project=devel:arm_toolchain:Mobile:Tizen_Common

Patch Set 2:

I can't find any information of flavour of sigaltstack. 

http://www.gnu.org/software/libc/manual/html_node/Signal-Stack.html

Does you mean all sigstack() will be substituted to sigaltstack()?

Patch Set 2:

> Does you mean all sigstack() will be substituted to sigaltstack()?
Manual says so.
For example http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man3/sigstack.3.html says "All new applications should be written using sigaltstack()."
Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Fix rpm build error pth_mctx.c:480:2: error: #error "Unsupported Linux (g)libc version and/or platform"
commitMessage:
Fix rpm build error
pth_mctx.c:480:2: error: #error "Unsupported Linux (g)libc version and/or platform"

This happens because there's a Linux kernel version check that
unfortunately only recognises 2.x versions, so it classifies a
3.x kernel as "braindead", which selects sjljlx and causes the
breakage.

The fix is to expand the kernel version regexp in aclocal.m4 to
also accept 3.x kernels

Link: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/attachment.cgi?id=591825

Change-Id: I0bf3356dda16d1d8e39811e92633699df15145ad
Signed-off-by: Mykola Tryshnivskyy <mykola.tryshnivskyy@globallogic.com>

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 1: Verified+1 Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.
